wikipedia_page.main: Lillian Forrester born Lillian Williamson (born 1879) was a British suffragette who led an attack on the Manchester Art Gallery.

response: Along with Lillian Forrester and Annie Briggs she damaged several paintings in  Manchester Art Gallery on 13 April 1913 and was arrested. They broke the glass and four of which were damaged by the broken glass.

The National Portrait Gallery holds three copies of this doctored photograph: included in a collective "Surveillance Photograph of Militant Suffragettes", in a "Criminal Record Office memorandum, Issued 24 April 1914" along with Lillian Forrester, and as a single image.
